education.degree: Doctor of Philosophy in Environmental Engineering and Science

education.description: Specialized industrial biotechnology production process improvement. Research focused on the design of a scalable industrial process for ectoine bioproduction and the use of novel extremophiles that produce extremolyte cocktails to enhance industrially relevant in vitro bacterial growth as supplemental additives.

education.degree: Master of Science in Environmental Engineering and Science
education.description: Specialized in water treatment technologies, molecular biology and biotechnology. Thesis focused on the development of a rapid and portable analytical method for in-field detection of fusobacterium necrophorum in cattle ruminal samples.

Comprehensive education in environmental engineering principles, with focus on water resource management, contaminated site characterization and environmental remediation. Thesis focused on developing a proposal for a remediation plan for the Venice Lagoon, Condega, Esteli, Nicaragua.
achievements: Manager of Laboratory volunteers for environmental project
Graduated with Honors and academic excellence

researchProjects.title: Novel extremophiles produce extremolyte cocktails that enhance industrially relevant in vitro bacterial growth as supplemental additives
researchProjects.funding: National Institute of Health / Rice University
researchProjects.description: Doctor of Philosophy in Environmental Engineering and Science, Main Project: Novel extremophiles produce extremolyte cocktails that enhance industrially relevant in vitro bacterial growth as supplemental additives.
objectives: Enrichment and isolation of extremophilic bacteria from soil and wastewater samples.
DNA extraction, 16S rRNA gene Sanger sequencing, and whole-genome nanopore sequencing.
Genomic and pangenomic analysis of isolates and the identification of mutations in target genes.
Phylogenetic identification and classification of isolates with extremolyte production potential.
Application of culture-produced, non-purified extremolyte cocktails as growth additives in industrial bacterial culture media to enhance bacterial growth.
Metabolomic analysis to quantify the extremolytes produced by each extremophile in the culture medium.
Design and modification of culture media and growth conditions to optimize the growth of target extremophiles and their extremolyte extracellular production using a 96-well microplate reader.

Use of extremolyte cocktails to stimulate the growth of bacterias with industrial applications, including Zymomonas mobilis, Pseudomonas putida, Bacillus subtilis, B. amyloliquefaciens, and B. licheniformis.

researchProjects.title: Design of a scalable industrial process for ectoine bioproduction
researchProjects.funding: National Institute of Health / Rice University
researchProjects.description: Doctor of Philosophy in Environmental Engineering and Science, Main Project: Design of a scalable industrial process for ectoine bioproduction.
objectives: Reactivation and enrichment of ectoine-producing bacteria from the NRRL culture collection.
Development of HPLC and LC-MS/MS methods for the detection of ectoine and hydroxyectoine.
Optimization of ectoine and hydroxyectoine bioproduction in high-efficiency extremophyle producers.
Laboratory-scale extracellular ectoine production in a 10-L bioreactor/fermenter.
Design of a low-energy method for purification of ectoine and hydroxyectoine.

researchProjects.title: Development of a rapid and portable analytical method for in-field detection of Fusobacterium necrophorum in cattle ruminal samples.
researchProjects.funding: Nanotechnology-Enabled Water Treatment Institute (NEWT) / Rice University
researchProjects.description: Master of Science in Environmental Engineering and Science, Thesis: Development of a rapid and portable analytical method for in-field detection of Fusobacterium necrophorum in cattle ruminal samples.
objectives: Adaptation of in-situ DNA extraction techniques, such as direct DNA elution, magnetic beads, and dipstick methods, for F. necrophorum DNA extraction.
Amplification of F. necrophorum DNA in cattle rumen fluid samples using PCR, LAMP, and qLAMP to establish standard results for comparison.
Adaptation of the open-source colorimeter (manufactured by IO RODEO) for real-time qLAMP measurements with spectrometric and fluorometric readings.
Design of an incubation chamber for metal machining and modification of the CircuitPython software to continuously record measurements during the LAMP incubation.
Development of a method for quantitative estimation of amplified DNA using qLAMP with real-time spectrometric and fluorometric readings from the modified equipment.

researchProjects.title: Extended-spectrum Œ≤-lactamases genes in Gram-negative isolates from an urban river in Nicaragua
researchProjects.funding: Molecular Biology Center / Central American University
researchProjects.description: Participation in research during internship in Molecular Biology Center at Central American University. Extended-spectrum Œ≤-lactamases genes in Gram-negative isolates from an urban river in Nicaragua, published in the Brazilian Journal of Biology (2024).
objectives: Project review and formulation.
In-situ water sampling, isolation of Gram-negative bacteria, and DNA extraction.
Identification of isolates using API biochemical tests and 16S rRNA gene amplification.
Sanger sequencing of extended-spectrum Œ≤-lactamase antibiotic resistance genes.
Identification of potential contamination sources and data analysis.

researchProjects.title: Proposal of a remediation plan for the Venice Lagoon, Condega, Esteli, Nicaragua.
researchProjects.funding: Central American University / Condega, Esteli Municipal Office
researchProjects.description: Bachelor of Engineering in Environmental Engineering, Thesis: Proposal of a remediation plan for the Venice Lagoon, Condega, Esteli, Nicaragua.
objectives: Project formulation and funding search in collaboration with the municipal government.
Water monitoring and physicochemical laboratory analysis of water, soil, and sediments.
In-field data collection to develop the ‚ÄúNutrient Delivery Ratio‚Äù (NDR) and the ‚ÄúEnvironmental Quality‚Äù environmental prediction scenario models using the InVEST software.
Handmade bathymetry of Laguna de Venecia during the dry season of 2021.
Environmental education workshops for farm owners in the Venice lagoon micro-watershed.
